Posted By: Thanato5 (12/9/2012 3:09:16 PM)

posts.post_content:
Historic. The very first unblockable creature.  
  
The dual lands like [Underground Sea](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Underground Sea) counted (and still count) as basic land types, and back then there just weren't that many other nonbasic lands. If you weren't going mono-artifact, you were susceptible to one of the five landwalks.  
  
Obviously "![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol): This creature is unblockable until end of turn" is not aggressively costed, even for its day... until you remember that **you were required to run Homelands cards in many tournament formats of that time.** Giant Slug plus [Feast of the Unicorn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=2918) was a serious late-game finisher.  
  
If you ever play some kind of Old Cards Pauper game, run the slugfeast beast with [Wall of Shadows](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Shadows) and [Will-o'-the-Wisp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=83411), both of which are nasty with Feast of the Unicorn. You could employ [Drudge Skeletons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=357) and [Unholy Strength](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unholy Strength) to round... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Historic. The very first unblockable creature.

The dual lands like Underground Sea counted (and still count) as basic land types, and back then there just weren't that many other nonbasic lands. If you weren't going mono-artifact, you were susceptible to one of the five landwalks.

Obviously ": This creature is unblockable until end of turn" is not aggressively costed, even for its day... until you remember that you were required to run Homelands cards in many tournament formats of that time. Giant Slug plus Feast of the Unicorn was a serious late-game finisher.

If you ever play some kind of Old Cards Pauper game, run the slugfeast beast with Wall of Shadows and Will-o'-the-Wisp, both of which are nasty with Feast of the Unicorn. You could employ Drudge Skeletons and Unholy Strength to round... (see all)
